website_summaries.verdict: A top-of-the-line model with responsive wireless technology. Overall, a reliable, user-friendly meat thermometer with cutting-edge technology.
pros: Has a sturdy build and modern capabilities
Wireless feature is awesome – wander away from your grill (for example) and monitor food temperature remotely
Has a 3-year warranty when you register it
cons: Occasional inaccurate readings, especially of the programmed temperatures, have been reported, but this is a common concern of digital models
Some faulty units, but customers service is prompt

website_summaries.verdict: Sets up easily and offers both excellent signal distance and a rugged probe.
pros: Comes with a dual probe to monitor both the food and grill/smoker temperature
Probe is rated for temperatures up to 716 degrees
Easy setup, with no sync required
cons: No low temperature alarm to warn if the grill/smoker stops or goes out

customer_reviews.title: This thermometer is great!
customer_reviews.text: This thermometer is great! I used it today to cook a brisket. I put one probe in the meat and the other in the smoker. Set the alarm to go off at 160 degrees and it worked perfectly. I love having the receiver in the house while it cooks outside. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Erspamer

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable Thermometer
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. First, to look at it you would think it was rugged and water proof. Not so. Cheap made and Not water proof. Would not stay calibrated and temp would vary as much as 20* under true reading. Changed batteries and still way off true reading. I discovered the problem when the meat I was smoking came out over cooked. Purchased a cheap digital probe to compare and that's when I discovered the issue. Sent Email to company requesting information or some kind of response. Waited 2 weeks and no response. Returned yesterday
customer_reviews.author: Crumb

customer_reviews.title: Great product for grilling and smoking
customer_reviews.text: I use this primarily with my Traeger smoker. It's definitely a 5* product. I can put on two different meats/fishes/veggies and know the internal temp of each. Great when you are smoking two different thicknesses of meat too. I've also used it on the grill with equally stellar results. Let's me put the meat on, walk away, and then follow the progress - especially for low and slow cooking. I did leave the batteries installed over the winter, and they leaked. :( But ThermoPro was there for me. They actually man their 800 number (so unusual these days!), and replaced my sending unit right away. so.. not only a 5* product, but also 5* service. Kudos to ThermoPro!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rodan

customer_reviews.title: Too Early to Tell, But Accuracy is Questionable.
customer_reviews.text: Although the dual-probe thermometer looks great and was super easy to set up, I'm not sure how accurate the thermometer actually is. I need to test/calibrate it to be sure. The reason I say this is because I have a pellet grill and the digital control panel temperature said 250 degrees. The analog thermometer on the grill lid also said 250 degrees(plus or minus 2-3 degrees), but the ThermoPro temp was reading 275-295 or higher. The fact that 2 of 3 thermometers read the same thing makes me think the temperature on the ThermoPro is off. Once I have a chance to review in more depth and calibrate with ice water @ 32 degrees, I will post an updated review.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P.

customer_reviews.title: 2 big misses
customer_reviews.text: 1 star due to 2 BIG MISSES from a feature perspective: 1. The description says, "Dual Probe Monitors Two Different Food or One Meat and Grill/ Oven/ Smoker's Temperature". This is completely false, as the 2 probes are too long to monitor the temperature of a grill. The 2 probes are really only good for monitoring the temperature of food. 2. No low temperature warning. This means you have to manually monitor the grill temperature yourself so that you can add charcoals before your grill temperature dips too low. This product is really only good for monitoring food temperature, and would probably get a 5 star rating from me if it didn't claim to be able to monitor grill temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Damion Wiltshire

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after less than 10 uses
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this thermometer in August of 2019 and it has already stopped working. The transmitter and receiver do not connect with each other. I have followed the instructions on how to re-connect them if needed but it does nothing. I am a grill enthusiast and care for my grilling related products to a tee because it is a big passion of mine. These have been properly cleaned and kept in the box when not in use. I would absolutely advise you to buy a different product. I live in Michigan and grill year around. A "Wireless" thermometer is absolutely needed and there is just nothing wireless about this product. It seems to be CHEAP!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great product - even better cusgtomer service! -- Buy this now!!!
customer_reviews.text: Full disclosure - wannabe pit master here using the also awesome Pit Barrel Cooker and my trusty ThermoPro TP-20. Absolutely essential if you are fanatical about internal temperatures and you want to limit opening the lid of your smoker/grill/cooker. Brisket, pork butt, turkey, chicken, all fantastic with these essential tools. I bought this TP-20 in 2018... fast forward to 2020 and one of my probes failed me. I called ThermoPro customer support - BAM! They are sending out two replacement probes to me! I can't ask for better service for such an awesome product... Buy it now!
customer_reviews.author: JAccount

customer_reviews.title: Take the negative reviews seriously! Don't risk your roast!
customer_reviews.text: Could never get it to read correctly. Tried two years in a row, with several people (including young, tech savvy people who cook) trying to use it and set it up on our Christmas prime rib roasts. The first year we were excited to use this and ended up overcooking the prime rib. Thought we must have not used it correctly. We tried it again on our Thanksgiving turkey and then for this Christmas' prime rib, but also used our old old thermometer and found that this one was off every time, both sensors! Going back to an old fashioned non-electronic thermometer. Meat is too expensive to risk! I threw this mess away, I don't want a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Ali D

customer_reviews.title: Great Product...Better Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I really dig this thermometer. I have a set up where I have to run up and down stairs while using the smoker and it was getting pretty tough running up and down stairs all day. My initial unit stopped working after about 6 months. I got the dreaded "LLL" on the display, without even having the probes plugged in. I called customer service and they answered within a minute, with a real human being, and immediately sent me out a new unit. Customer service was exceptional; they really stand by their product. I also bought one of these for my son and he has had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: SpiteMan

customer_reviews.title: GREAT! TILL IT'S NOT.
customer_reviews.text: ****UPDATE**** I Called Thermopro customer service, they were very nice. I explained what had happen, and they are sending me new probes. 5 Stars for customer service. I changed from 3 star to 4 star just because if you spend $60 your probe quality should be better and last more than 5 times...... Sixth time i used this, one of the probes went bad and was reading 140 degrees hotter than what it was. I have always took very good care of the probes, I've always made sure not to pull/twist the probe wires. Otherwise I love this unit. Until this, its been very accurate. Great range and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Haw

customer_reviews.title: Dual sensors gave two significantly different readings in same glass of warm water
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the product for a few months and felt like something wasn’t right so I decided to test the sensors. I put hot water in a glass and put the two probes from this unit in the water along with a separate probe from another company. I also used a laser to test so 4 test devices total. The water measured 102 with the laser, 103 with the third party sensor and the dual sensors with this unit measured 106 and 94. Significant difference when trying to accurately measure Potentially uncooked foods.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk or defective?
customer_reviews.text: Junk! I really wish we would've tried out on something different before the return time was up. My husband received this for Father's Day and was so excited to get it as he had seen it advertised on a cooking show he loves and thought it would work great... not so. He thought maybe you needed to use this on thicker cut of meat to work. So we used again last night on a brisket and the temperature is reading hotter than it is. I wish I could get a replacement to try again.
customer_reviews.author: agogel

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Receiver Disconnects Too Often
customer_reviews.text: The probes are accurate and easy to use with the dual probe base station. The only reason I bought this was to be able to have the wireless receiver to be mobile with and see temps. Well it kept disconnecting so I figured I went too far or had too many barriers between myself and the base unit. So I left the receiver literally next to the base unit and after 30 minutes, it disconnected again. I'll be searching for a better wireless system now.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Smith

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy unless you want to return it later cause it doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: This in my opinion sucked. I used it 3 times and the only time the temperature wasn’t off by 30-40 degrees is when I had the entire prose stuck inside a brisket. For meats like steak or chicken, the temperature was off by a lot. I ended up just having to check the meats every so often on my grill probe. I’m not sure if it was the probes, they didn’t look like the picture. I would not recommend this to anyone. Maybe I had a bad unit, but the unit seems built very nice. Returned unit now back in the hunt for a good unit.
customer_reviews.author: pownski

customer_reviews.title: Fantastuc, versatile wireless dual probe.
customer_reviews.text: Using this today for the first time. I'm trying to become more instrumented and accurate when I smoke meats. I am using the dual probes on this, situated right above the grates in my Oklahoma joes smoker, to read out grill level temps. I drilled holes in the back of the smoker and used rubber grommets purchased separately to hold the probes in place without leaking smoke or anything to the outside. Working very well. The useless analog temp probe mounted in the lid rads 180 while with this probe I know that one end of the smoker grate is 234 and the other is 231. Now I can manage temps to a much tighter window.
customer_reviews.author: Person Reviewer 9814987

customer_reviews.title: Good tool as long as you keep the instruction manual
customer_reviews.text: This is an effective tool--just be sure to keep the instructions nearby. It's not the most intuitive user interface. After about a year of not using it, I came back to it and just tried what seemed like every possible key combo to no avail. I will now go google the right long-press button combo to set the temp alarm #2, but what would have been wrong with just labeling that key instead of making me refer to a supplemental guide?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The range of the wireless is better than the claimed distance
customer_reviews.text: My old remote thermometer (from a different company) finally failed when the probe wire frayed. I do not think this ThermoPro will fray. The braiding appears to be very sturdy. Tests of the temperature readings indicate it is accurate. The beef rib roast and the duck I have cooked using it both came out at the doneness I wished. I recommend it. I chose this model because I often cook for someone who likes her steaks more done than I do, and the dual probe makes that easy. Also the second meat probe (when only one meat is being cooked) can monitor the oven/grill temperature.
customer_reviews.author: royar

customer_reviews.title: First cook a huge success!
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly right out of the box. Near intuitive operation and didn't need to go the instruction book. Used one probe to measure grill temp and the other in the meat. Flawless and was right there with the old ThermPop instant read I have. Large numbers make it easy to read. And the remote signal was strong and consistent. Very pleased! 3 weeks later.....still very pleased. I keep checking with accurate independent thermometers and on the button every time. If grilling/smoking is your passion, this item is a must for your toys. Would definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bbq and smoker thermometer
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about purchasing this thermometer due to the many other brands and options available out there. I'm so glad I bought this one though. It has a good wireless reading range and the led readings are easy to see with or without the light. The preset doneness settings are also pretty handy. I use this mostly for the smoker but have used it in the oven and it's just amazing. Only thing is I wished it came with a case included, but I bought a cheap one that is designed for this model. Overall, very happy with what I paid for and got out of it. Definitely recommend it for anyone looking for a decent probe thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Steven B

customer_reviews.title: ThermoPro TP20 Is a Great Choice
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a simple and reliable product...the TP20 seems like a great choice. I like the non-slip cover on the transmitter and receiver, the dual probes, the simplicity (common batteries, no bluetooth, no wifi, etc.), the wireless range, and the lifetime probe replacement offer. I have only used the TP20 once. But again, it seems to be the correct choice. The range of the receiver is great, way beyond the range needed. Other BBQr's tell me that replacement probes will be needed some day. However, the probes seems very durable to me. If my opinion of the TP20 changes toward the negative in the future, I will update my review. Today however, that seems very unlikely!
customer_reviews.author: R. Renner

customer_reviews.title: Failed in less than 2 Weeks!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this about 2 weeks ago, tested both probes in ice water, and they were pretty spot on (32°F/34°F). I used them twice, both times for 2 inch thick NY Strips, and they worked wonderfully. I went to use them on boneless chicken breast and one probe read 128 F while the other probe read 186F. Both probes were fully inserted into the meat. I was hoping for at least a few months of accurate readings but I couldn't even make it 2 whole weeks. Great product if it doesn't fail like mine did.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hare

customer_reviews.title: Tough as nails
customer_reviews.text: This thing has taken a beating and still going. I may or may not have left the unit in my oven (where I store my BBQ odds and ends when not in use) and turned it on just long enough to disfigure the housing and somehow it still works and reads accurate. If you're looking for a simple unit with some durability then I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JaySin S.

customer_reviews.title: Must have for smokers
customer_reviews.text: This has been an absolutely fantastic addition to my Weber Smokey Mountain. Having this showed me just how far off the stock dome temperature gauge was off on my smoker. It is really nice to be able to accurately monitor the temp of the meat and the smoker at the same time. The probe fits in the weber access port perfectly. This unit has really nice features and provides temp updates remotely anywhere in my home. Everything feels well made and it functions flawlessly. My only regret is that I didn't buy one sooner.
customer_reviews.author: ScubaSteve

customer_reviews.title: Good but didn't last a year
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Good accuracy. Good connectivity. However, 1 probe completely stopped working in April 2020 and yesterday (May 23), while smoking pulled pork for Memorial Day party, other probe went bad. Temp sat at 200 for over an hour. Checked meat with different thermometer, well over 220. Needless to say, pork was pretty dry. Also, the base station doesn't turn on consistently. So overall, it was good while it last. But seems like 1 year is the max use out of it. Be ready to purchase new one every year.
customer_reviews.author: MFowles

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I used this thermometer around 8 times before it became useless. I started noticing that everything was coming up to temperature extremely quick when smoking meats. At first it was only one probe and then the second one started giving incorrect readings while smoking a thanksgiving turkey. The bird wasn’t cooked completely, making me have to put it back on and keep checking with an old instant read thermometer. The temperature reads at least 35 degrees high now for this thermometer. I have both probes in a glass of ice and they are reading 51 and 69 degrees. Complete garbage.
customer_reviews.author: D. Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Very useful on the BBQ
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a previous model for years until the probe went bad, then got this one delivered just in time as I was mid-way through a BBQ. I'm also getting a couple of replacement probes. I can set the kamado BBQ temp with one probe in the meat and another keeping watch on the cooking temp. I can be upstairs in my office and the remote shows me the temps and will give a sound alert when it gets near the goal temperature. That is really handy! I DO wish it had a way to turn off the beeper entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Gralfus

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Owned several over many years. This thermometer is easy to use. It has many features however you don't have to use them or work through them with key strokes to get a basic temperature reading and monitor. I like that. Range is very good too. I get about 60 feet reliably and thats through a few walls. Its two parts with a dedicated RF link. both parts display temp so you dont have to play around with having to get both ends working when all you need is a quick temp reading. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kelcher

customer_reviews.title: Great product but probes seem to be cheap.
customer_reviews.text: So I would love to give this 5 stars since it is my favorite and I use it all the time. Easy to use and adjust to what you’re doing. One of the probes was very accurate and the other wouldn’t read past 74 degrees. Only using one probe and so far it hasn’t let me down. The range on the remote works great so when I’m hosting a party I can run around all over my house and still have connection to the base.
customer_reviews.author: Erik m

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup. Intuitive to use.
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak to durability, but for the first use, in a smoker, with one probe being used to monitor internal stove temperature and one probe used to monitor meat temperature, it worked perfectly. There isn't much of a learning curve. Everything was pretty intuitive. It made it easy to do other things around the house and feel confident that I knew what was going on with the smoker. I will edit later if I find that durability is an issue. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R. Pocock

customer_reviews.title: An Absolute Must-Have
customer_reviews.text: First up was a 10 lb brisket. I used one probe to monitor my grill temp and the other to monitor internal temp of the beef. I was able to maintain the proper smoking temp for the 9 hours it took to reach the exact internal temperature I was looking for. The brisket came out perfect! There is simply no way this kind of precision could be had without the remote thermometer. The sender and receiver never lost contact which allowed me to tend to other chores around the house. My only minor gripe is that setting the alarm temps is a little more difficult than it needs to be. Otherwise I am very happy with this thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Carl from Alexandria

customer_reviews.title: Major convenience and "Must have"
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love being able to remotely monitor the temperature in the smoker. Range is adequate, and reaches about 40' through three walls, with the receiver in a WiFi dense area. Biggest complaint is the constant alarming if you're fluctuating near your target temp. You can silence the alarm once it goes off, but if it dips and returns to target, the alarm goes off again. This can be avoided by setting your target temp a little high, but then you run the risk of staying above you target temp for the duration fo the cook. I do wish it also had a low temperature alarm that could be used with the grate probe.
customer_reviews.author: Bravo Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great device, great Service
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a replacement for a cheap wireless thermometer. This one works very well. Connectivity without problems. Dual probes is a bonus to detect if the grill’s on fire. Making sure the connectors are properly inserted results in reliable readings. The probes are a bit sensitive. After 6 months I had 2 failing within weeks of each other. Posted and immediately got a response from the company who sent me two replacements. Now that’s standing behind your product! And just in case, I ordered 2 replacement probes that aren’t that expensive. And this works in your oven, too.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebus

customer_reviews.title: If you BBQ, this is a must have.
customer_reviews.text: This ThermoPro is wonderful! I can finally BBQ with consistently perfect results. I have been using it a few times a week for a long time with no problem at all. Weather it be Beef, pork, fish or poultry, this ThermoPro TP20 Wireless two channel thermometer system makes me a master at the BBQ. I tend to become distracted at times while "multitasking" but with the huge range of the remote, I am instantly informed when to tend the BBQ. I highly recommend the ThermoPro TP20 to anyone. You can't beat it, even at twice the price!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis S.

customer_reviews.title: Received one as gift. Bought one to give as gift
customer_reviews.text: I received one of the ThermoPro TP20 Thermometers as a Christmas gift from my son. It has made a huge difference when I'm smoking meat or deep frying meat. I can easily monitor the cooking temperature and the meat temperature. I had the best success (i.e., keeping the smoker in the right temperature zone throughout the day) with my last Pork Boston Butt in the smoker because I was able to keep a close eye on the temperatures. I have since bought one to give as a gift. It is that good. My only knock is getting used to how it cycles through the 2 sensors and settings. Once you are used to it, it's reasonably easy and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: ScottConn62

customer_reviews.title: Loved my  Maverick ET-733  but it was time to get another I ...
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased the Maverick ET-733 about 3 years old... Loved it but it was time to get another I purchased another grill. I looked at the reviews so I purchased the ThermoPro TP20 after unboxing it seemed to be cheaply made so i questioned durability. I returned and got the Thermoworks Smoke on sale for 69.00 it feels more durable and better quality.. Just my opinion
customer_reviews.author: carmoejorkel

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the units and the way the remote clips to my grill are fantastic. There very heavy duty unfortunately the accuracy of the probes is horrible and are not consistent. I ran a side by side comparison with my thermoworks signal I bought after the temperature in my probes and insta thermometer were not matching up. What I noticed is chamber temp usually stayed with in 1 to 2 degrees of each other. The meat temps were 6-8 at lower temps as they came closure to the 145 degrees for pork the temp gap was only 2 degrees 138.8 to the thermopro 137.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a TP-09B in December, it was working great for about 3 months, then the calibration went way off, tried to find a way to recalibrate, no luck. Very disappointed, intended to send back, but being handicapped, I was preoccupied with appointments and work. Called but could not call during their "office hours". Needed a reliable wireless thermometer, because of so many positive reviews by friends in my Masterbuilt group, I decided to give this one a try. I assure you if this one fails, I will never invest in a Thermopro product again. So far, so good, but "Time will Tell".
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A. Morales Sr

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a year now. The dual probe option is awesome so you can keep track of multiple meats at once or 2 different sections of the meat at the same time. It also comes with a clip that you clip the probe to the rack so you can keep track if the internal temperature of the smoker l, sometimes the temp gauge on the smoker is off. I really like the alarm feature for when your meat gets to temperature, manual temp setting or preprogrammed. I would recommend buying a case to hold it when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Wilt

customer_reviews.title: Great product - So far
customer_reviews.text: I really hope this continues to work as it did the first 2 times. My girlfriend liked it so much, she bought one for her dad for Father's Day and one for herself. I still cannot believe what a great product and a great deal this is. It comes with everything you need to get going. It is packed very nicely and so easy to use. The temperature was 100% accurate for a med rate, 2 inches thick NY steak in a cast iron pan. I absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: S. Ghaemi

customer_reviews.title: Accurate to the point that it matches my temp. probe!
customer_reviews.text: I cooked a prime rib for the first time and i found it very easy to use! I also started to compare it to my instant temp probe and it was reading identical! My prime rib came out great. The only small issue i found was the clip on the reader that you carry around. It was pretty flimsy and does not have enough tension. I had it clipped to my apron and every time i bent over it feel to the floor. But the device is sturdy enough to withstand the 8 times i dropped it so that was a big plus!!!
customer_reviews.author: ADAM TREVINO

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding tool for grilling and smoking meat!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding experience with the unit as well as customer service. I like the idea of tracking the temperature of the meat and the smoke. Don't believe the naysayers that the timer only does minutes and seconds. IT DOES HOURS AND MINUTES! ThermPro Customer Service is out of this world. The transmitter unit got too close to the grill resulting in the battery compartment melting and fusing together. I called their U.S. 1-800 number and spoke to a live representative to explain the situation, and promised to replace the unit as it is under warranty. I have no hesitation in recommending this model TP20 to anyone that has a requirement to maintain situational awareness for two temperature settings while grilling.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Consistent and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time on a long smoke brisket, 18 hrs. Never had connectivity issues at 35ish feet away. Was reading about 2 degrees off from my Traeger temp sensors the entire time which was nice. The sensors cleaned off easily and feel nice and sturdy. The display is very legible from a distance, only complaint is how loud it beeps but I honestly didn’t check to see if there is a way to lower it. Overall we are very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: sal kille

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and to use
customer_reviews.text: I have used it twice so Far .. Easy to setup and to use . as for distance it will get at least 100 ft transmit range had mine inside back porch and was 100 ft away still receiving signals . went into separate metal building and it would not receive... as soon as I stepped out of the door signal came back .. inside same house as porch received signal thru 2 walls no problem cooked some homemade Lebanon bologna and this unit helped me produce a fine product .. cooked just right couple days later cooked some brats in the oven as another test... without the ThermoPro I would have cooked too long
customer_reviews.author: Paintball K.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate????
customer_reviews.text: So I am use to using a regular thermometer that I keep in during cooking, currently have that and this digital one in same chunk of meat and there is a 20degree difference..so now I'm not sure..is it accurate I dont know you tell me. So far not impressed, had issues with the probes this morning continued to read lll i switched sides from 1 to 2 to see if it was the probe or the Jack after alot of jacking around it finally started working, so i have 1 for inside my smoker temp next to a hanging thermometer, it's also reading about 10 degrees different...the alarm is nice but still unsure on the accuracy
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Holm

customer_reviews.title: Update
customer_reviews.text: Update: Both Probes are way off after a few uses. The Camp Chef Vaults thermometer was off but I know medium is around 250. Probe was showing 345, even out of the smoker. Internal one was off too. Had brisket at 200 within 15 minutes of the cook. Meat was actually at 95. So, unreliable. Original reviewAlways looking for a second reading, I researched, just as I am for more cookout stuff, but as I do, in the garage putting together a lounger, my ribs are at 92 internal and the smoker is at 180. And, this is my go to for every meat I cook.
customer_reviews.author: Tiki-Gene

customer_reviews.title: Great unit
customer_reviews.text: There are so many reviews on this device, and all of them seem good. There were a few old reviews about bad probes, and that seems to have been rectified. The company is very customer service minded, and seems like they are doing everything possible to make your buying experience good. I really don't see how you can go wrong with this product, because even if it doesn't work, they will stand behind it. And, who now a days gives you a 3 year warranty on anything. If you need a device like this, this is the one to get, and the right people to get it from.
customer_reviews.author: R. Scaffidi

customer_reviews.title: Look for a more durable product.
customer_reviews.text: Setting it up is not as easy as I would expect, but it worked as I wanted, bbq outside, me inside tracking progress. BUT, then one probe went bad, OK until about 90 degrees, then it jumps to Overheat alarm. I continued to use it as a single probe thermometer. Then sending unit wouldn’t communicate with remote. Trashed it. Disappointed with short life. Worked well for a year so 2 stars...
customer_reviews.author: Denny Da K

customer_reviews.title: Worked well initially— disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived timely and appeared to work well until the probes stopped working — as other reviews have stated. Additionally, the display has become difficult to view. The display becomes faint and thus makes it unusable. Warranty states the probes will be replaced. Am still — since February!!!! — waiting for my replacement probes. Had made contact with vendor. Now they won’t respond. Product is of no use if the probes don’t work and screen is difficult to see. I’m sure price was a factor in my decision to purchase this item. Had I known this was to be the result (and made worse by their customer service) I would have selected another product/vendor.
customer_reviews.author: D. Viviente

customer_reviews.title: Winner thermometer wireless system
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product for the price. Very accurate temperature readings will help anyone with any grilling, baking, or cooking needs. The directions were extremely easy to read for set up, and within five minutes of getting it out of the box, I was already using it with my grill. Great for barbecue and slow smoking outside, especially for grills that don’t have very accurate thermometers or unpredictable fire management due to older or lesser-quality smokers.
customer_reviews.author: D. Farris

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile device
customer_reviews.text: I am waiting for my new grill to be delivered so I actually haven't tried this thermometer for cooking. I can report that the device is extremely easy to setup, program and has a whole bunch of very useful features. I can't wait to use it on my new grill. The company seems very customer oriented and I was very pleased to see they offered an extended (3 yr.) warranty just for registering the device.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Not same reading on both probes and temp is off
customer_reviews.text: One probe seems to be off by 3-4 degrees no matter what I try. Photo shows TP wireless probes in same ice bath with my Weber meat thermometer. As you can see the temp is off and a bit inconsistent despite allowing them to get fully adjusted for 10 minutes. Wireless range seems good. The units seem lightweight and extremely fragile. The belt clip on the receiver has a LOT of play and I don't expect it to survive a fall. I am contemplating returning them and getting the Maverick.
customer_reviews.author: ricecowboy

customer_reviews.title: I don't have to stand by the grill all the time now.
customer_reviews.text: It took me a little while to learn how to set the different temps but now takes only seconds. I love tracking two temps at same time on my remote belt. I can mingle with guests or be preparing other food and monitor two different temperatures and have alarm when temp is reached. Temps are accurate (make sure probe in center of meat). Can't wait to use in my smoker as I like to cold smoke and keeping smoke heavy without raising temperature is tricky in my unit so this will help me watch the fire temp and smoker temp without having to be in the smoke house at all times.
customer_reviews.author: William C Martineau

customer_reviews.title: Great remote thermometer!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a reliable, durable remote thermometer. I had purchase a less expensive remote thermometer a few years ago, and it wasn’t worth the money. I finally decided to try again, and I chose this thermometer based on the reputation of the company, and the reviews of this thermometer. We love it! It has consistently transmitted, and the temperature has been very accurate. It’s very easy to use, and very durable. He hasn’t tried using both probes yet. We are both very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nanila

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money look for another reliable thermometer
customer_reviews.text: Bought it 6 month ago. The thermometer worked well on the first 2 times only. Accuracy was deteriorating by each time I used it. Now it’s completely stopped transmitting the temperature to the main screen. Look for another thermometer. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed T. Sarg

customer_reviews.title: Great unit
customer_reviews.text: I've had this and heavily used this system for almost three years. I've left the probe unit outside for months in the rain,, snow and wind. I basically treated it like garbage. I honestly have taken very poor care of it. Every once in a while I wipe it down and if I am in a fine mood ill let it probe my meat on the rest period. NOT ONE SINGLE PROBLEM! NOT ONE! This has been reliable, trustworthy and all around great.
customer_reviews.author: william smith

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised!
customer_reviews.text: The product worked as described in the product's information materials. It's very easy to use. I was delighted to finally find an effective way to more accurately grill-to-temp meats, chicken, fish, pork and of course, hamburgers! I found that the "fine-tuning" adjustment ability is great - setting the temperature to below (5 degrees or so) the recommended temp (i.e. 160 degrees for medium chicken) allows the grilled food to reach the right temp when removed from the grill...bringing it right up to the desired temp. The 3-year warranty is the best!
customer_reviews.author: Online shopper

customer_reviews.title: great product.... I would definitely buy this again
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product.... I had bought a Maverick with single thermistor and the thermistor failed after only about a dozen cooks. From taking this out of the box it is easy to see that the thermistor is built more sturdy.. with a heavier braided casing around the wire. Plus.. he says he will replace a broken thermistor... (and someone posted that he sent a new thermistor when he needed one) I would definitely get this again.. the thermistor clip is a little wanky.. I purchased the probe clip separately which clips to the wire grate and holds the thermistor up about 1 inch above grate.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bard

customer_reviews.title: Works great until it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: Love this unit's ability to detect temperatures, features exactly as advertised. However after about 10 uses both thermometer probes have gone haywire - one reads that it is below the lowest temperature, the other is 80-90 degrees above ambient. I am confident that I have never gotten the contact ends wet, and have otherwise taken good care of the unit. So it's great, just know you'll probably have to buy replacement probes semi-regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Rick W.

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two Meaters, one for my home and one for my camp. I have/had lots of problems with the Bluetooth connection. It seems that the connection is always lost at critical times during the cook, or it simply won't connect at all. This is the second ThermoPro that I have. While it is a bit less convenient to have to have wires to the probe, it has never let me down. The temperatures seem accurate and the meat comes out as set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thermometer does not register correct temperature.
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy the unit is to use, unfortunately the meat probes do not register a correct temperature, I'm going to see if i can find better meat probes somewhere else that i can connect to this unit on amazon. Does anyone have a suggestion in a better probe to plug into this unit? I only used the included probes once, it was taking so long for the meat to get to the temp i needed, used my old thermometer and it showed 14 degrees higher then the ThermoPro.
customer_reviews.author: Seth C.

customer_reviews.title: Best dual wireless thermometer for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace a defective, single probe thermometer I bought at WalMart. This TP20 works great, long wireless range, timer, hanger for sending unit & kickstand for receiver. The rubberized cover on the units make them rugged and impact resistant. The only improvement I would like to see is color-coded probe wires (or markings) for Probe-1 & Probe-2. My Traeger pellet grill has non-wireless dual probes, but the wires are color-marked & connectors are either white or black to differentiate between Probes-1 & 2. But, this is a minor issue. If my TP20 was stolen, I would buy TP20 again!
customer_reviews.author: Tn Vol

customer_reviews.title: highly innacurate!
customer_reviews.text: I did several test on the grill with both probes next to each other. The reading difference between probes was 12 degrees when the grill was at around 325 (probe 1) and 337 (probe 2), - to as much as 80 degrees! when the grill was 411 (probe 1) and 491 (probe 2). I returned this thermometer and bought Thermoworks smoke. Thermoworks gives me an accuracy between probes of 1.4 degrees (worst case) but most of the time is within 0.2 degrees between probes doing the same test. What a difference!!
customer_reviews.author: artcien

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Did you know this can also be used as a thermometer for people? But if you aren’t desperate, I recommend this to be exclusively for food. It works and makes over other under cooking food a thing of the past. My meat smoking husband swears by it because he can keep close track of the food while he is inside playing video games.Don’t leave it on your smoker, because it will melt.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gray

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again! Great product! Accurate readings. Easy to use, clean, and store!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing distance. Temperature updates between wireless module and transmitter about every 15-30 seconds. Backlit display on the wireless receiver. Nice long probes. Knurled (textured) grip. Handles a decent amount of heat. Nice silicone socks for the electronics that come off and wash easy. Great for roasts and bbq on the grill. Handles my oven on 475°F with no problem at all. Easy to clean and maintain. Comes with plastic spools to wind up each probe wire and store the probes neatly in a drawer. I usually use one probe for what I’m cooking and a second probe to measure the ambient temperature of the oven.
customer_reviews.author: Donna83

customer_reviews.title: I Didn't Realize How Much I Needed This
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my Thermo Pro for about a year and a half. Prior to that, I would literally just guess if whatever I was BBQ-ing was actually done - with varying degrees of success. Now I can sit a hundred feet from my Kamado Joe and see what the grill temperature and internal temperature are. This is especially helpful on low-and-slow cooks like pork butts and brisket. I had a temp probe fail recently, so I contacted Thermo Pro and they promptly sent me out a replacement at no charge. If you're currently bbq-ing without monitoring temperature, you need to give this unit a try.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Good remote temperature display with 2 channels.
customer_reviews.text: Even though i am not using this as it's intended purpose, it is working very well. I needed a good 2 channel temperature display that was relatively accurate. The remote feature is a plus. I am monitoring 2 different placed for our 3D printer. inside the cabinet, and inside the filament dryer. Very happy with the results. When my PLA is reading RARE, I know I am good to go! LOL.
customer_reviews.author: DARREN PELLECCHIA

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Customer Care
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned this thermometer set for over 18 months. Generally it’s worked as advertised. Seems to be accurate and I live the wireless feature. Then it started giving me issues. Bad readings, no readings. Thought it might be the probes going bad. I was prepared to buy something else. Then to my surprise,I emailed the company with my issues. After a few days of traded emails they actually sent me a whole new unit. That’s great customer service.obviously I hope the new one lasts longer but I get electronics. So thanks thermopro for the exceptional customer care!
customer_reviews.author: G. Mekler

customer_reviews.title: Did not last a year.
customer_reviews.text: This ThermoPro TP20 was impressive at first but quickly degraded. I had one probe fail within the first five months. Bought a new probe because I couldn't figure out how to contact manufacturer to receive a new one under warranty and was in a hurry. Next, the display on the receiver started to fade to the point where we have to turn it to an extreme angle just to read it. New batteries did not help. Now the transmitter has failed to read any temperatures, unless by some chance both probes went bad at once, very unlikely though. Again new batteries do not help. My advice would be to look elsewhere for a more reliable wireless cooking thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great product, even better Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but one of my probe ports broke after 9 months. I will say this....I used the living sh*t out of this thing and it was amazing. I definitely feel it was worth every penny. Now the kicker...I called for help about the probe port to see if there was a way to repair it...their excellent customer service team SHIPPED ME A NEW ONE! Wow...they really stand behind their product. So, to recap....great product! The probe and sending unit clips are a bit non functional, and I wish so much for a low temp alarm but the accuracy, range and value ate outstanding!
customer_reviews.author: The One and Only Seadog

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: The probes broke after about a year and a half of regular use. I have to say they lasted a long time for being in the baebeque with the lid put on and off a million times. I tried to be careful washing them and not get water in where the wire goes into the probe. The range of the transmitter was really good. I could still read it in the kitchen and the BBQ is in thew backyard. I have had quite a few of these type units and this one is the best. I probably would be throwing it out if they didn't offer replacement probes. They were a free replacement this time.
customer_reviews.author: TIM MARKLEY

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Customer Service!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my ThermoPro for 14 months now, and love it. I use it on average, twice a week for low and slow cooks. Not too long ago I noticed I had meat coming out undercooked when the TP20 showed it should be done. After testing in hot water, I found the probe was off about 25 degrees (too hot). I called ThermoPro and in less than five minutes on the phone, they had sent out a replacement probe. This is well worth the purchase price!
customer_reviews.author: D. Mirate

customer_reviews.title: Works until it doesn't.
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok up until return window. One of probes is now +20° & the other -10° from actual temp. Completely useless now. I probably took care of this unit more than most would. It was put away properly every use, and I only got 4 uses out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike BB

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Issue on first use, both thermocouples started out at room temperature but soon overshot actual temperature of grill by 100° F. Varified by grill thermometer and handheld IR thermometer. Grill was at 375° F so not very high. Still had problems after removing probes from grill, allowed the probes to return to normal temperature, unplugged and checked connections, restarted both units, and place back in grill. These are probably the incorrect type of thermocouple being paired with the recover due to a scaling error reading the resistance values. Due to not being reliable for it's only function I gave it 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: FrostViking

customer_reviews.title: Re-synch
customer_reviews.text: I was going to give a bad review because it lost synch with wireless unit. Tech support was helpful. To synch turn both units on and press and hold the "Mode" button on wireless unit for 5 seconds. It will re-synch with the probe. Seems so easy that they should include in on the instructions, online, etc. Other methods I found didn't work. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Roboiii

customer_reviews.title: Great high quality thermometer!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had previously bought two in-oven meat thermometers. Both died on first time use because they couldn't handle the temperature. I was reluctant to buy another but was cooking prime rib. I could try cooking by time but you don't want to mess up on an expensive cut a meat. This worked like a charm! I love the wireless aspect and the big display. You can set temp alarms. I didn't use all the functionality this time but am looking forward to using it more. I do both outdoor grilling and oven roasting. Very high quality!
customer_reviews.author: Kendoso

customer_reviews.title: This is my best purchase yet
customer_reviews.text: This is my best purchase yet! I am using this to gauge the temperature of the water in the hot water tank of an RV. RV's require you to turn on the hot water when needed... the problem is you do not know when it has reached a reasonable temperature so that you can turn off the heating mechanism. With the probe placed between the insulation and the outside wall of the tank, I can set the desired temperature and will receive an alert when the temperature is reached. I then know to turn off the heating mechanism. Love this.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Great for budget and beginners!
customer_reviews.text: I got my first charcoal grill at the beginning of the summer and couldn’t wait to start grilling. I mastered the timings of stakes and burgers but I wanted to experiment more. I then ventured into the world of smoking and doing pork butts. This product helps me get the perfect internal temperature every time! Just set your meat on the grill and let the ThermoPro tell you when it’s done. It’s very easy to read and program. I have mine set for prob one to tell me the meat internal temp and prob two tells me the grill temp. No more need to constantly keep lifting the lid. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Potts

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooking Thermometer
customer_reviews.text: My hubby just used this item for the first time today & says it's fantastic!! He has a rough time over the grill with getting things just right. Especially with the medium variety of beef and while it took him a bit longer to get done today he seemed to be satisfied with the outcome as was I. This thermometer is well made and easy to use. We hope the quality will be worth the cost and that we will have it for quite some time. However if it should need replaced I think we would purchase again and we do recommend it to others with the desire to properly cook their food to a desired level.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs B

customer_reviews.title: Now I've made the perfect steak!
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves medium-rare tenderloins and they aren't cheap. So I got this thermometer after my simple one stopped working correctly. It's easy to use and our steaks have been perfect every time. The shipping was quick (2 days). I also bought a nice case to keep it in. I use the skillet to oven method and don't use a grill anymore. Maybe with this thermometer I'll try it there again. It's very nice to know the inside temperature of the meat at all times, remotely.
customer_reviews.author: James B

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Mine seems to be low at low temperatures and high and higher temperatures. Maybe all my thermometers are wrong, but the one I've used several times that worked well, but only has a single probe is reading 30 degrees lower than this ThermoPro. That other thermometer matches the on on my smoker, so it seems to me the thermopro is wrong. I wish I had tested it in water before I started.
customer_reviews.author: Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Great product with even better support
customer_reviews.text: The screen got very dim after 17 months. I tried changing batteries with no improvement, so I used the chat feature on the thermapro website. Less than ten minutes later a new unit was enroute to me.. no charge. Can't ask for better support
customer_reviews.author: Long Time Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This thing works well and is affordable! If you want to keep accurate temps and need to be able to walk away for a bit, I would say this is what you’re looking for! Battery life is good, range was better than expected, setting parameters for an alarm was a life savor.... a few times our temps dipped in our smoker and we were able to add more wood and keep temps where they needed to be. It was a great tool for bbq-ing!
customer_reviews.author: woodland.andrea

customer_reviews.title: The product is super easy to use & has many great features
customer_reviews.text: We used the TP20 last night on our Big Green Egg grill for two racks of lamb. The product is super easy to use & has many great features. The 2 probes allowed us to check each rack of lamb. Although the the 2 pieces of meat were virtually identical one reached the temperature we were looking for a lot quicker than the other. This will be great for our Thanksgiving turkey. My brother was over for dinner & promptly ordered a TP20 for himself.
customer_reviews.author: JAK

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband right before thanksgiving. He smoked a turkey and it was the best turkey we ever had and we got a lot of complements from family that was also the most juicy turkey. We did the same receipt the year before with out this thermometer and it was okay. I feel this product really helped to not overcook or undercook the meat.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Manning

customer_reviews.title: i could and did silence the alarm
customer_reviews.text: ease of setup and use. Wish it did have a usb recharged ability versus aaa batteries. Scrolling/tabbing thru the meat menu when i accidentally touched it, maybe have a screen/button lock ability when set-up was accomplished. The steel mesh cable attached to the stainless steel probes could be colored red to remind you its hot. Luckily I didn't touch the mesh cables or probes when removing meat from grill...just unplugged from unit. Since it is apparent probes fail a lot...provide extra set with initial purchase. I will be searching for a USB recharge model since this unit was easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Two temps, very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is the best of several remote thermometers that we have. In addition to having preset temps for various meats, it can also be set to whatever temp you want. You can monitor food in 2 locations (breast and thigh) or you can monitor meat and ambient temp. This latter feature is great for smoking. The set up is easy and so far we've not had problems with signal loss from being too far from the transmitter. I bought an extra probe clip for measuring ambient temp but I didn't need it, one comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Bocamo

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome! Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: So far I've used it five times with a Weber smoker and a Weber gas grill. Temperature difference between the ThermoPro and the Weber thermometers was in the 25-60o range. I've used the built in thermometer on the gas grill for 6 years and now I understand why cooking times always seemed off. The range on the ThermoPro wireless remote is excellent. Had no issues with the grills being in the backyard and the remote in the house, 50+ feet away. It was simple to setup and has a loud beep. You'll hear it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A. Upton

customer_reviews.title: A great temp monitoring device
customer_reviews.text: After having now used this remote for everything from smoking brisket and grilling steak and hamburger I can now say with confidence I'd gladly recommend this to family and friends. Having dual probes gives you the opportunity to monitor the inside temperature of the grill or if you already have a thermometer for checking grill temp, to use it to monitor separate items on the grill. The transmitter slows me to keep tabs on the items being cooked without raising the grill cover. I checked the accuracy of the probes and they are within +\- 1 degree of each other. Everything I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: MTPaul

customer_reviews.title: My ThermoPro TP20 makes smoking stress free
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I can fire up my smoker and insert the probes, take the remote unit and go do whatever I want anywhere in the house and not have to fret and keep checking on my meat. The first time I used this on a brisket felt way more stress free. All you have to do is set your temp target and wait for the alarm. No more running out to the smoker regularly to check temps, and no more stressing over missing the target temp. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Gohlke

customer_reviews.title: A must product for any one who smokes or grills
customer_reviews.text: A must product if you own a pellet feed smoker or any smoker for that matter. The two most important things to know when you are smoking is the temperature of the smoker and the temperature of whatever you are smoking. Thermos Pro does both as it allows you to walk away to do other things because of the wireless capability. The biggest complaint I read about with smokers is the inaccuracies of the temperature gauge that comes with the smokers as well as the meat thermometers. That’s why I purchased the Thermo Pro. And guess what, the temperature gauge of the smoker was not accurate. I didn’t even bother using the meat probe that came with smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory W. Wertman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my iGrill Mini with this one. iGrill burns thru batteries (the quarter sized expensive ones) like nobody's bizness, this uses AAA (or AA?). I like the two probes for a large slab of meat, or to use one for the grill temp. I prefer cooking to specific meat temp rather than a particular doneness but you have either option. I chimes when you reach your cooking doneness setting. Rangewise it's awesome too. I walked two doors up the street and still had a connction to the sensor. My iGrill would constantly unsync with my iPhone app. I'm thrilled with this one.
customer_reviews.author: S. HYANS

customer_reviews.title: Very inaccurate the temp is actually 275
customer_reviews.text: This thing out of box reading 30-50ish off my 3 grill thermometers. I’ll try figure out if way calibrate it. But at this point not good for smoking at 250 it’s way off. Just update I tried these again side by side there reading almost 100 either direct and there both 50 off actual temp. I wouldn’t trust these if feeding anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Addison

customer_reviews.title: Another "best thing since sliced bread" product!
customer_reviews.text: No wonder this unit is a best seller at Amazon. It works perfectly, and finally takes the guesswork out of smoker cooking. No longer do I have to wonder when the meat is adequately cooked. The unit is well-designed, and having USDA recommended temperatures on the monitor keeps you from having to look them up. It transmits through a wall with no problem, enabling you to cook all of your sides in the house while smoking. The alarm feature, which indicates the endpoint of desired internal temperature, is especially helpful.
customer_reviews.author: N. Case

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Might have gotten a bad one, but...... The unit that the probes plug into eats batteries, they have to be removed between uses or it drains them. Also, probes(or temp unit) failed on 3rd use, says HHH. I'm assuming its telling me over temp when I know its not. Both probes do the same thing with fresh batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great makes it easy to keep an eye on the grill.
customer_reviews.text: Works great makes it easy to keep an eye on the grill and meat at the same time. You can set temp alarms for either probe, a count down timer or a count up. Update may 2019: After using this repeatedly for over a year, my review is still 5 stars. It works really well, great signal range, long battery life. I've done several 12+hr smokes and have only changed the batteries once in a year. I use this to set alarms to wake me up in the middle of the night during a smoke, when i need to do something with the meat, or when it needs to come off the grill.
customer_reviews.author: M. Quick

customer_reviews.title: Warrantee leaves a little to be desired
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product and I think it is performed well. One of my probes went bad and the company sent me a new one. However I am disappointed because the probe that they sent me was not an original to what came with this product to begin with but it looks like a probe that would come with a cheap Walmart digital thermometer. Even though I’m disappointed I will still continue to support this company and buy their products because I think they are that good.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Boehm

customer_reviews.title: Probes Are Too Big For Accurate Readings
customer_reviews.text: I expected the cheap looking quality given the price but the real surprise was the temp probes that are about the size would expect for a whole hog BBQ. They're 8 inches long (straight) and 1/8" across--maybe suitable for a whole brisket or pork butt but not ribs or any reasonable size portion of meat (there is only two of us). The probe hangs out of the meat and basically registers the temp of the smoker. Useless. Back to the thermoworks.
customer_reviews.author: John Ellenberger

customer_reviews.title: Amazing customer service
customer_reviews.text: Amazing customer service. They really do replace the probes and even the units themselves. My original unit went out and they replaced it with a new one. A few probes went out as well and they replaced it. I BBQ a few times a month, so I put a lot of wear and tear on the probes and units. I would definitely recommend for the customer service alone. Although, I can't give it 5 stars because the original unit went down, but the company did make it right by replacing it. I definitely understand the probes going bad especially if used in high temperatures. Bottom line is that I would purchase the product again based on the customer service alone.
customer_reviews.author: Ikaika C. Arnado

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I hoped to use this product to monitor temperatures when cooking/smoking large roasts or pork butts. I liked being able to monitor the temp from a distance, having an easy-to-read display, and having a probe I could leave inserted in the oven or on the smoker. The probe wore out very quickly and was inaccurate and unreliable. I got a free replacement probe, but it wasn't any better, so I no longer use it. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Made some filets with this unit and came out perfect. Seared for 2 minutes on each side and placed them in the oven at 350 F until center temperature reached 125 F before taking out of the oven then let them rest. Just measured internal temperature on one filet. Perfect medium rare was achieved on both filets. Very happy with this purchase and looking forward to using it as often as possible. Loved the idea of not standing over the oven and checking every few minutes to make sure the meat was not over cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Al D.

product_meta.title: ThermoPro TP20 Wireless Remote Digital Cooking Food Meat Thermometer with Dual Probe for Smoker Grill BBQ Thermometer
feature_bullets: 【Hands Free Monitor】Wireless digital meat thermometer with dual probe monitors food or oven/grill/smoker temps up to 300 feet away, enabling you to enjoy your company without continuously excusing yourself

【Hands Free Monitor】Wireless digital meat thermometer with dual probe monitors food or oven/grill/smoker temps up to 300 feet away, enabling you to enjoy your company without continuously excusing yourself

【Hassle-Free Setup】No synch required, say goodbye to the tedious setup steps; Large LCD displays both food and oven temps and timer for the most intuitive experience; Back-lit for use in low light condition

【USDA Preset Temperature Settings】BBQ thermometer with preset temperatures for 9 types of meat and their various doneness levels recommended by USDA; All of the preset temps can be reset to your desired tastes

【Durable and Accurate Probes】Grilling thermometer features food grade stainless steel probe with step-down tip design to get temperature more precisely and quickly; Probe wires can withstand up to 716°F

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars12,527 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
